notesStmt.note: Damp at head (in part). Old losses infilled. Stained.

Two additional fragmentary pieces appended: folios 185r-190v, Be᾿ur ha-melitsah, an exposition on the earlier portions of the second book of the Organon, and folios 190v-191v, Levi ben Gershom's notes 1-4 on the Intermediate Commentary of Averroes on Porphyry's Introduction to the Organon.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Perush ῾al Be᾿ur ha-emtsa῾i shel Ibn Rushd ῾al Sifre ha-higayon shel Aristo פרוש על הבאור האמצעי של אבן רשד על ספרי ההגיון של אריסטו

collation.p: 24 quires of 8 leaves each (last quire missing 1 leaf), marked with catchwords at the end, and also at the end of each of the first three leaves of ach quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square and semi-curive script of the 15th century. Ḥayim Porovintsal (Provenzal): inscribed with his name in the colophon, folio 184v.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Levi ben Gershon. Supercommentary Upon Ibn Rushd. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 18,687.'
